notesStmt.note: A considerable number of leaves are soiled and mutilated, some of them seriously damaged.

Numerous modest geometric and floral motifs in the margins, in colours or in brown ink.The middle word marked on folios 105r, 107v, between the columns. Avraham ben Natan: inscribed with his name, 212v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch with Targum Onḳelos and masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 22 quires, mostly quires of 10 leaves, apart from the last one, which has only 6 leaves. Quires marked with catchwords on the last page and signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last pages.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square script (Persian?) with superlinear punctuation, probably of 11th to 12th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 1 carpet page with micrographic design, in colours. Ten Commandments in 2 decorated panels, in colours. 4 masoretic notes in decorated panels. 6 full borders, in colours. Numerous decorated parashah signs, in colours. Numerous coloured initial words at the beginning of the parashiyot. Numerous modest geometric and floral motifs in the margins, in colours or in brown ink.
212v1 carpet page with micrographic design, in colours.
73v Ten Commandments in 2 decorated panels, in colours.
Numerous decorated parashah signs, in colours. Numerous coloured initial words at the beginning of the parashiyot.
Couloured letters in masoretic notes at the end of each pericope.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house binding. Spine: 'Pentateuch with Targum. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2363.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 23 July 1881.
